title: Spacial Awareness
text:
Why Spatial Analysis Matters
Modern sports are increasingly about space creation and control. Understanding these spatial concepts gives teams and analysts powerful tools to:

Develop more effective tactical strategies
Identify weaknesses in opposing team formations
Train players to better recognize spatial opportunities
Make data-driven decisions during matches



Convexhull
Imagine stretching a rubber band around your team’s defenders - that’s essentially what a Convex Hull shows us!

The colored shape that wraps around the outermost players
How this shape expands and contracts as players move
The total area the defense is effectively covering

What This Tells Us: - How compact or spread out your defense is - The spaces attackers might exploit - How well your team maintains its defensive shape



Voronoi
Ever wondered how much space each player “owns” on the field?

Each player has their own “territory” shown by different colors
These territories constantly change as players move
The boundaries show where one player’s influence ends and another’s begins

What This Tells Us: - Which team controls more of the field - Where there might be space to pass or move into - How well positioned players are relative to each other
It’s like each player has their own personal bubble, and these bubbles adjust in real-time based on everyone’s position.

title: About our Goals
text:
Breaking Down Defensive Formations with Convex Hull
The Convex Hull analysis provides a revolutionary way to understand how teams and players occupy and control space on the field. Imagine drawing a rubber band around a group of players – the shape it forms is the convex hull. This mathematical concept helps us:

Measure the effective defensive coverage area
Identify gaps in defensive formations
Analyze team compactness and expansion
Track how defensive shapes change throughout the game

By analyzing these patterns, teams can better understand their defensive positioning and identify opportunities to exploit opposing team formations.


Creating Opportunities with Voronoi Diagrams
Voronoi diagrams take spatial analysis to the next level by dividing the playing field into regions of influence. Each region represents the area where a player has the most control compared to all other players. This analysis helps in:

Understanding player dominance in specific areas
Identifying optimal passing lanes
Recognizing space creation opportunities
Analyzing territorial control during different phases of play

Through Voronoi analysis, we can quantify which team is controlling more valuable space and identify tactical adjustments to create better scoring opportunities.


Our Approach
This website combines theoretical knowledge with practical applications, providing:

Detailed explanations of spatial analysis concepts
Real-game examples and case studies
Interactive visualizations
Practical tools and techniques for analysts and coaches

Whether you’re a coach, analyst, or enthusiast, our goal is to help you better understand and apply these powerful spatial analysis concepts to enhance your game understanding and strategic planning.
